intro: Seseli schansiense, commonly known as the Schansian seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Seseli schansiense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
